sub_title: Communications and Engagement Manager at NHS England
summary: A skilled and ambitious communications professional with a passion for improving employee and client engagement through a strong and clear communication focus. I have extensive experience in delivering creative content across multiple platforms for both internal and external audiences supported by exceptional verbal and written skills.

profile_positions.description:
Part of the Digital First Primary Care team - working at a national level to support the transformation of primary care through promoting the implementation, understanding and improving digital tools within general practice. This aims to support patient access to appropriate and timely care, help practices better manage demand, and improve patient and staff experience across England. 

- Overall management of the Communications and Engagement workstream including ensuring progress is being made towards milestones, that this progress is understood, and that risks and issues are effectively communicated and either mitigated or escalated as necessary.

- Developing close working relationships with colleagues, communications teams (both national and regional) and other key stakeholder, working with them to align messages and communications opportunities.

- Support and develop communication and engagement strategies; to include the utilisation of a wide range of communications tools, including online platforms, to effectively communicate to a wide range of stakeholders.

- Work with team members and stakeholders to develop core messages and engaging content for distribution across multiple channels. 

- Lead local and national event management and coordination for the team, including identifying appropriate events to disseminate comms messages and overseeing the team’s participation. Also leading on the strategy and practicalities for setting up internally managed events and ensuring that the messaging is presented in a strategic way.
profile_positions.title: Communications and Engagement Manager

profile_positions.description: Planned sabbatical travelling to France, USA, Columbia, Ecuador, Galápagos Islands, Peru, Bolivia, Chile, Argentina and Brazil. Travel forms part of my ongoing global cultural experience to widen my communication skills, languages, problem solving and adaptability.
profile_positions.title: Career sabbatical

profile_positions.description:
- Lead on all communications channels, including newsletters, intranet, website, social media and other ad hoc publications.

- Manage engagement and consultation activities.  

- Manage UCL Estates engagement with the media.  

- Monitor and ensure compliance with brand guidelines, ensuring consistency in visual appearance and tone across all key communication channels.
profile_positions.title: Communications Manager

company.name: Guy's and St Thomas' NHS Foundation Trust

profile_positions.company: Guy's and St Thomas'​ NHS Foundation Trust
profile_positions.description:
- Lead on communication approaches, including strategies, campaigns, initiatives and events for project and programme managers, Heads of Service and other senior managers.

- Prepare and implement project communication plans, clearly identifying milestones for designated communication and engagement activity.

- Organise and facilitate events, VIP visits, engagement workshops and other conference type activities. 

- Create must-follow social media feeds and website content to develop an engaged community of followers.

- Lead on external storytelling through effective public and media relations for Essentia Trading Ltd.

- Write, design or commission creative marketing and communication material.

- Monitor and ensure compliance with brand identity guidelines.
profile_positions.title: Senior Marketing Officer

profile_positions.company: Guy's and St Thomas'​ NHS Foundation Trust
profile_positions.description:
- Use project management techniques to support delivery of the communications strategy and Trust’s Patient and Public Involvement strategy and to provide project support as required.

- Devised and implement new efficiency system and monitoring processes for completion of project communications programme and action plans.

- Organise and facilitate events, workshops, engagement events and other conference type activities for capital projects.

- Raise awareness about projects being undertaken with both internal and external stakeholders.
profile_positions.title: Project Officer - Communications & Stakeholder Engagement

company.name: The Hillingdon Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

profile_positions.company: The Hillingdon Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust
profile_positions.description:
• Provide support to patients, carers and relatives, representing their views and resolving local difficulties by working in partnership with members of staff

• Liaise with a wide range of staff, including executives, consultants and matrons, to problem solve and coordinate satisfactory outcomes for patients in a timely manner

• Adopting a patient centric approach, especially when dealing with challenging problems, to better understand individual issues and resolving conflicts

• Assist in the recruitment and day to day management of the Trust’s 400+ volunteers

• Assist in the development and creation of patient leaflets including clinical communication for paediatrics, general information leaflets and posters

• Implement a patient feedback process to identify trends, analyse using issue trees as a problem solving framework and work with teams to implement improvements across different departments
profile_positions.title: Patient Advice and Liaison Service Officer

volunteer_experiences.description: Role involves assisting with delivering the perfect match day experience for visitors to Alianz Park. Duties range weekly but included escorting the players during autograph signings and photo opportunities, meeter and greeter and spectator services.
